description.narrative: By 2023, children have increased equitable access to inclusive quality preschool and fundamental education.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023, children have increased equitable access to inclusive quality preschool and fundamental education.

description.narrative: In 2019, 100,792 children (51,404 girls), including returnees, (IDPs) and from poorer households were reintegrated and/or maintained in the education system, one third of them in emergency situations. 22 preschool classrooms were rehabilited and constructed and complemented by provision of learning materials. Capacity-building of 256 teachers contributed to increased quality of preschool education for 13,000 children (6,630 girls). This is the result of a partnership with the (MoE), NGOs: War Child Holland, ODEDIM, Jesuit Refugee Services and AVSI. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:09/01/2020
